virtual void* Agent::callMethod ( int  functionId,

Is called from Agents.callAll.

It invokes the function specified with functionId as passing arguments to this function. A user-derived Agent class must implement this method.

void Agent::kill (  )  [inline]

Terminates the calling agent upon a next call to Agents.manageAll( ).

More specifically, kill( ) sets the "alive" variable false.

int Agent::map ( int  initPopulation,
vector< int >  size,
vector< int >  index 
) [inline]

Returns the number of agents to initially instantiate on a place indexed with coordinates[].

The maxAgents parameter indicates the number of agents to create over the entire application. The argument size[] defines the size of the "Place" matrix to which a given "Agent" class belongs. The system-provided (thus default) map( ) method distributes agents over places uniformly as in: maxAgents / size.length The map( ) method may be overloaded by an application-specific method. A user-provided map( ) method may ignore maxAgents when creating agents.

Parameters:
initPopulation 
size 
index 
Returns:

bool Agent::migrate ( vector< int >  index  )  [protected]

Initiates an agent migration upon a next call to Agents.manageAll( ).

More specifically, migrate( ) updates the calling agent’s index[].

void Agent::spawn ( int  numAgents,
vector< void * >  arguments,
int  arg_size 
) [protected]

Spawns a “numAgents’ of new agents, as passing arguments[i] (with arg_size) to the i-th new agent upon a next call to Agents.manageAll( ).

More specifically, spawn( ) changes the calling agent’s newChildren.

Parameters:
numAgents 
arguments 
arg_size

Field Documentation

int Agent::agentId [protected]

Is this agent’s identifier.

It is calculated as: the sequence number * the size of this agent’s belonging matrix + the index of the current place when all places are flattened to a single dimensional array.

int Agent::agentsHandle [protected]

Maintains this handle of the agents class to which this agent belongs.

bool Agent::alive [protected]

Is true while this agent is active.

Once it is set false, this agent is killed upon a next call to Agents.manageAll( ).

vector<void*> Agent::arguments [protected]

Is an array of arguments, each passed to a different new child.

vector<int> Agent::index [protected]

Is an array that maintains the coordinates of where this agent resides.

Intuitively, index[0], index[1], and index[2] correspond to coordinates of x, y, and z, or those of i, j, and k.

void* Agent::migratableData [protected]

Is a pointer to a user-allocated space that will be carried with the agent when it migrates to a different space.

To be cast to a user-defined data type.

int Agent::migratableDataSize [protected]

Indicates the size of the migratebleData space.

int Agent::newChildren [protected]

Is the number of new children created by this agent upon a next call to Agents.manageAll( ).

int Agent::parentId [protected]

Is the identifier of this agent’s parent.

Place* Agent::place [protected]

Points to the current place where this agent resides.

int Agent::placesHandle [protected]

Maintains this handle of the agents class with which this agent is associated.
